thread.title: Host Catonsville upends Franklin for first win on the baseball diamond
thread.title_full: Host Catonsville upends Franklin for first win on the baseball diamond

author: Craig Clary
title: Host Catonsville upends Franklin for first win on the baseball diamond
text:
Host Catonsville upends Franklin for first win on the baseball diamond Catonsville baseball beats Franklin 
Catonsville High defeated Franklin 11-1 to even its record at 1-1 (Craig Clary/BSMG) 
Catonsville High defeated Franklin 11-1 to even its record at 1-1 (Craig Clary/BSMG) Caption Catonsville defeats Lansdowne in boys basketball 
Catonsville's Ross Kidd talks about Comets win over Lansdowne. (Craig Clary / BSMG)

Catonsville High defeated Franklin 11-1 to even its record at 1-1 (Craig Clary/BSMG) 
Catonsville High defeated Franklin 11-1 to even its record at 1-1 (Craig Clary/BSMG) Caption Spalding baseball beats Mount St. Joseph 
Spalding's Peter Godrick talks about the Cavaliers 12-1 victory over Mount St. Joseph on Thursday, March 23. (Brent Kennedy / BSMG) 
Spalding's Peter Godrick talks about the Cavaliers 12-1 victory over Mount St. Joseph on Thursday, March 23. (Brent Kennedy / BSMG) Caption Catonsville girls win state championship 
Catonsville girls basketball team are Class 4A state champs (Craig Clary/BSMG) 
Catonsville girls basketball team are Class 4A state champs (Craig Clary/BSMG) Caption Western Tech Vs. Randallstown Boys Basketball

Randallstown eliminates Western Tech in regional basketball semifinals (Craig Clary/BSMG) 
Dutton was 3-for-3 with two RBIs and a double and triple against Loch Raven. 
Catonsville built the lead to 6-1 in the bottom of the third. 
Getzendanner reached on a error, Deitz singled and Brick walked to load the bases with one out. 
Matt Rehder reached on a bases loaded walk and Brent Johns reached on an error to plate the last two runs. 
“They had a couple miscues, but we did put the bat on the ball a lot,” Catonsville coach Rich Hambor said. “We struck out a few too many times, but we’ve got to work on making a little bit better contact.” 
All six Comets made contact in the bottom of the fourth inning when they scored two more runs and gained an 8-1 lead. 
Moulthrop singled and Getzendanner drove him home with a double to right center field. 
Getzendanner advanced to third on an errant throw and he scored on a ground out by Deitz. 
Relief pitcher Baker retired eight straight hitters and 9 of 10 in three innings of work. 
He relieved Kidd, who allowed two hits, three walks and a run in two innings. 
The Catonsville defense also played errorless ball. 
With the stricter limits on how many pitches can be thrown, the Comets saved the bullpen by ending the game in the fifth. 
Joe Rubalcaba’s pinch-hit sacrifice fly plated Rehder with the first run and an error on a ground ball off the bat of Will Jones scored Ethan Alioto and Rehder with the game-ending runs. 
Hambor was happy with his team’s patience that produced nine walks. 
“Coach [Eric] Warm talked about a little bit different approach that we are going to take that is going to help extend our pitchers as well,” Hambor said. “We just tried to make them work, and I think they threw four guys today.” 
Getting the first win, after starting last year’s 13-6 season with two losses, is satisfying, but Hambor knows it’s just the beginning. 
“We’ve got 16 more games plus the playoffs so we’ve got a long way to go,” Hambor said. 
Brick certainly enjoyed his first varsity win. 
“It feels great,” he said. “It’s neat to represent the school.”
